title: Enterprise Architect - People
description:
**Job Description**
 We at H&M Group, have a vision to liberate fashion for the many. Our Enterprise Architecture team helps align and enable business and tech, provide holistic architecture direction and governance, balancing the long-term and the short-term. Using robust frameworks and best practices they support an effective and efficient tech delivery.
   

  

 To strengthen our team, we are now hiring more Enterprise Architects to further level up our support to business and tech in several areas.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 Our architecture landscape is divided into segments, where the Colleague segment covers our Talent management, Workforce management, Collaboration, Knowledge management, Compensation, Travel & Expense, HR Operations, IT Operating model, Portfolio management & corporate capabilities.
   

  

 As an Enterprise Architect – People, you will play a key role in shaping the future of HR, Collaboration and workforce management technology in a fast-evolving enterprise environment. You will work cross-functionally to define, optimize, and evolve our Collboration and HR technology landscape while enabling seamless Employee experiences across all touchpoints.
   

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**
**Technology Strategy & Business Alignment:**
* Define and drive the HR business functional & technology architecture, ensuring alignment with business strategy to enhance workforce efficiency, talent management, and operational effectiveness.
* Lead the transition from current to future state architectures, ensuring seamless execution through structured stakeholder engagement.
* Identify cross-dependencies between business processes and technology, guiding capability development, process improvements, and digital transformation initiatives.


**Architectural Governance & Optimization:**
* Establish and maintain enterprise-wide architecture principles, frameworks, and roadmaps to standardize HR technologies.
* Evaluate and improve the HR tech landscape, reducing technical debt, optimizing integration, and enhancing end-to-end business value.
* Assess industry trends and emerging technologies (AI, automation, RPA) to determine their potential impact on HR systems and workforce management.


**Strategic Leadership & Decision Support:**
* Guide and coach stakeholders on investment decisions, balancing risks, costs, and business priorities.
* Support in defining and implementing new operating models and technology-driven HR initiatives.
* Collaborate with third-party vendors, ensuring strategic partnerships align with business objectives and technology roadmaps.
* Work closely with architects across Talent, Workforce, Compensation, Collaboration, HR Operations, and Travel & Expense segments to integrate People technology solutions.
* Oversee solution design, integration development, and roadmap execution, ensuring HR technology delivers tangible business outcomes.
* Participate in enterprise architecture practices, fostering best practices and knowledge sharing across teams.


**YOU’LL WORK WITH**
 As an Enterprise Architect, you will collaborate closely with business stakeholder & architects across different segments, ensuring seamless integration between People, Employee Experience, and the broader enterprise architecture. You will work alongside Solution Architects, Enterprise Architects, and System Architects to define, optimize, and evolve our technology landscape while ensuring alignment with enterprise-wide strategies. Your role will bridge employee experience with other architectural segments, enabling a cohesive and scalable ecosystem that supports business objectives across all touchpoints.
   

  

**Who You Are**
**We are looking for people with..**
* Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields. Certifications in Enterprise Architecture frameworks (TOGAF) are a plus.
* 15+ years of experience in software engineering, business technology, or related roles, with 10+ years in a Solution or Enterprise Architecture capacity.
* 5+ years of experience in multiple segments, preferably within Retail/B2C industry.
* Experience working with business & tech stakeholders, using EA tools like LeanIX for architecture documentation and visualization.
* Strong knowledge of HR technologies across talent acquisition, workforce planning, compensation, collaboration, and HR operations.
* Experience in AI, automation, data analytics, and RPA for HR processes.
* Toolchain for I IT Operating model, Portfolio management & corporate capabilities
* Proven track record in architecture governance, defining standards, and leading cross-functional initiatives.
* Experience in vendor management and strategic third-party relationships to drive HR technology innovation.


**Good to Have:**
* Experience in business strategy, operating model development, portfolio management, and HR transformation initiatives.
* Exposure to enterprise risk, security, and compliance management in HR systems.
* Knowledge of sustainability, health, and safety management technologies.


**LOCATION:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. Read more about us here
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Cloud Engineering Manager
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring an
 **Engineering Manager** 
 ...
   

  

 This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and Cloud technologies to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

 The BootStack team designs, builds, and operates modern distributed systems on private infrastructure for customers. From Kubernetes to OpenStack and everything in-between, you'll be working with the latest technology in a fast-paced engineering environment. As a Cloud Engineering Manager for the BootStack team, you will be responsible for managing the engineers that oversee day-to-day Managed Service of customer environments, including customer service management, managed services operations and consistent product improvement engineering. Collaboration with customers, product engineering, and operations is critical to success.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This is a globally remote role.
   

  

**The role entails**
* Manage a growing engineering team to optimise the quality and velocity of both development and operations
* Identify and measure team health indicators
* Implement disciplined engineering and operations processes
* Represent the BootStack team with respect to stakeholders, customers, and external teams
* Ensure proper team focus on priorities, milestones, and deliverables
* Work to meet service level agreements with customer deployments around the globe
* Deliver quality managed services in a consistent, timely manner


**What we are looking for in you**
* Bachelors (or equivalent) education in a technology field
* Proven track record of professional experience of either software delivery using Python, Go, C, C++, Java, or similar and/or managing operations teams
* Proven experience with OpenStack
* Demonstrated strong commitment to testing methodologies and maintainable code quality
* Experience with Linux system administration, Ubuntu/Debian a plus
* Strong communication and cooperation skills
* Experience with agile software development methodologies
* Experience working in and managing distributed teams
* Technical aptitude for understanding complex distributed systems
* Experience with cloud topologies and technologies
* Travel to team and company events and customer meetings, roughly 20% or less


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

 This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and Cloud technologies to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

 The BootStack team designs, builds, and operates modern distributed systems on private infrastructure for customers. From Kubernetes to OpenStack and everything in-between, you'll be working with the latest technology in a fast-paced engineering environment. As a Cloud Engineering Manager for the BootStack team, you will be responsible for managing the engineers that oversee day-to-day Managed Service of customer environments, including customer service management, managed services operations and consistent product improvement engineering. Collaboration with customers, product engineering, and operations is critical to success.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This is a globally remote role.
   

  

**The role entails**
* Manage a growing engineering team to optimise the quality and velocity of both development and operations
* Identify and measure team health indicators
* Implement disciplined engineering and operations processes
* Represent the BootStack team with respect to stakeholders, customers, and external teams
* Ensure proper team focus on priorities, milestones, and deliverables
* Work to meet service level agreements with customer deployments around the globe
* Deliver quality managed services in a consistent, timely manner


**What we are looking for in you**
* Bachelors (or equivalent) education in a technology field
* Proven track record of professional experience of either software delivery using Python, Go, C, C++, Java, or similar and/or managing operations teams
* Proven experience with OpenStack
* Demonstrated strong commitment to testing methodologies and maintainable code quality
* Experience with Linux system administration, Ubuntu/Debian a plus
* Strong communication and cooperation skills
* Experience with agile software development methodologies
* Experience working in and managing distributed teams
* Technical aptitude for understanding complex distributed systems
* Experience with cloud topologies and technologies
* Travel to team and company events and customer meetings, roughly 20% or less


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Account Executive, Sweden
description:
Rubrik’s Sales organization is a united group of elite cross-functional sales professionals that help companies & government entities achieve resilience against cyberattacks, malicious insiders, and operational disruptions. We offer continuous professional growth and opportunity through our world-class sales enablement program. Our One Rubrik selling approach provides all the resources you need to exceed your goals, maximize your earnings potential, and take your career to the next level. All this while doing something truly purposeful, protecting the world's data.
   

  

 As an Enterprise Account Executive, you will have ownership of all elements of bookings growth in new and existing accounts across Sweden as a region. We are seeking a relentless self-starter who is hyper-focused on acquiring new logos by discovering and developing new opportunities, managing pipeline, and executing account strategies, while also encouraging existing customer expansion. The AE must drive pipeline generation daily while working with Sales Engineers, Sales Development, Channel Development, and Rubrik Channel Partners to exceed sales quotas.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Define and execute sales plans for the assigned territory to meet and exceed quota through prospecting, qualifying, managing, and closing sales opportunities
* Develop and manage sales pipeline to move a large number of strategic transactions through the sales process
* Identify and close new opportunities for growth working with a mix of mid-enterprise accounts
* Present Rubrik, Inc. solutions within complex data center design environments
* Co-sell and strategize with partners, distributors, and VAR’s to enable rapid growth
* Provide Rubrik, Inc. management with feedback about the local market opportunity and identification of new business opportunities and channel partnerships


**Experience You’ll Need**
* 5+ years Tech sales experience (selling either IT Infrastructure or SaaS)
* Fluent in Swedish
* Consistent track record landing net "new logos"
* Using MEDDPICC to drive complex sales cycles and close high-value deals
* Strong track record of performance selling to End User Fortune 1000
* Understanding and experience working with channel
* Highly driven, goal oriented "get it done" attitude
* Experience selling a complex solution


 Join Us in Securing the World's Data
   

  

 Rubrik (NYSE: RBRK) is on a mission to secure the world’s data. With Zero Trust Data Security™, we help organizations achieve business resilience against cyberattacks, malicious insiders, and operational disruptions. Rubrik Security Cloud, powered by machine learning, secures data across enterprise, cloud, and SaaS applications. We help organizations uphold data integrity, deliver data availability that withstands adverse conditions, continuously monitor data risks and threats, and restore businesses with their data when infrastructure is attacked.
   

  

 Linkedin | X (formerly Twitter) | Instagram | Rubrik.com
   

  

 Inclusion @ Rubrik
   

  

 At Rubrik, we are dedicated to fostering a culture where people from all backgrounds are valued, feel they belong, and believe they can succeed. Our commitment to inclusion is at the heart of our mission to secure the world’s data.
   

  

 Our goal is to hire and promote the best talent, regardless of background. We continually review our hiring practices to ensure fairness and strive to create an environment where every employee has equal access to opportunities for growth and excellence. We believe in empowering everyone to bring their authentic selves to work and achieve their fullest potential.
   

  

 Our inclusion strategy focuses on three core areas of our business and culture:
   

  

* Our Company: We are committed to building a merit-based organization that offers equal access to growth and success for all employees globally. Your potential is limitless here.
* Our Culture: We strive to create an inclusive atmosphere where individuals from all backgrounds feel a strong sense of belonging, can thrive, and do their best work. Your contributions help us innovate and break boundaries.
* Our Communities: We are dedicated to expanding our engagement with the communities we operate in, creating opportunities for underrepresented talent and driving greater innovation for our clients. Your impact extends beyond Rubrik, contributing to safer and stronger communities.


 Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled
   

  

 Rubrik is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
   

  

 Rubrik provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Rubrik complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
   

  

 Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please contact us at hr@rubrik.com if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.
   

  

 EEO IS THE LAW
   

  

 NOTIFICATION OF EMPLOYEE RIGHTS UNDER FEDERAL LABOR LAWS

title: Data Scientist
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Climate Data and Analytics
description:
**Data Scientist** 




  





 Do you want to design cutting-edge AI and ML solutions, work with advanced data models, and empower businesses with innovative analytics?
 



  





 Nexer Insight is looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm, Malmö, or Gothenburg. We invite you to embark on an exciting journey where you'll work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. At Nexer Insight, we are committed to leveraging advanced analytics, machine learning, and AI to drive innovation and deliver impactful solutions for our clients.
 



  





**Nexer Insight** 




 Nexer Insight is a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. As a Data Scientist with us, you'll work with cutting-edge technologies, including LLMs (Large Language Models), RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and advanced AI solutions. We value teamwork, professional growth, and a vibrant community spirit. With us, you'll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, collaborate with experts in the field, and make a meaningful impact in the intersection of data science and AI.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Develop advanced AI/ML models and design solutions leveraging LLMs for various AI use cases, including RAG and intelligent agents.
* Apply machine learning, statistical methods, and predictive modeling to solve real-world problems.
* Build and deploy data pipelines and cloud-based architectures for ML workloads and MLOps.
* Innovate and collaborate with clients to discover new business opportunities and develop tailored solutions.
* Work with NLP, computer vision, and containerized applications to deliver high-impact projects.
* Leverage platforms like Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake, and Azure ML for scalable and efficient workflows.
* Promote best practices for data science, from architecture and data quality to reliability and performance.



  





**Who You Are** 




 We expect you to have:
 


* Minimum 4 years within Data Science
* Strong understanding of LLMs and experience building solutions on top of them for AI-driven solutions.
* Experience with RAG and AI-driven agents.
* An analytical mindset and strong business acumen.
* Problem-solving aptitude and a proactive mindset.
* Hands-on experience with applied ML, statistics, and cloud architectures for MLOps.
* Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and familiarity with tools like Databricks.
* Knowledge of computer vision, NLP, SQL, and containerized apps.
* Experience with Azure cloud services such as Azure ML and Azure Data Lake.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.



  





**Why Nexer Insight?** 




 At Nexer Insight, we invest in our employees by providing professional development, certifications, and a vibrant working culture. With us, you'll be part of a team pushing boundaries and using advanced data science to create meaningful solutions for leading clients.
 



  





 Are you ready to take the next step in your career and explore the forefront of AI and data science? Apply today and join us on this exciting journey!

title: Software Engineers to Zalando
description:
**About The Company And The Role**
 We are looking for two Software Engineers to join Zalando, an international e-commerce company that is shaping the future of retail. This company provides a platform that serves millions of customers worldwide and is now expanding its engineering team to continue delivering innovative solutions. Here, you’ll have the chance to work with technologies such as Java, Kotlin, AWS, PostgreSQL, and Elasticsearch, all while collaborating with passionate teams focused on driving innovation.
   

  

 In the role of Software Engineer, you’ll develop and operate large-scale systems that ensure timely and accurate order fulfillment. Your primary focus will be to build backend applications that handle high volumes of data and deliver seamless experiences for customers and partners.
   

  

 At Zalando, you’ll be part of a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning. This role offers you the chance to contribute to an innovative, customer-centric organization that is reshaping the future of online retail.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Developing and maintaining high-performance, low-latency systems for data streaming and processing.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and scale solutions for fulfillment and customer experience.
* Taking ownership of applications, managing them from development through deployment and monitoring.
* Innovating and finding solutions to scale the platform in an increasingly complex ecosystem.
* Actively contributing to the development of new features and improvements.


 You’ll contribute to Zalando’s success by ensuring the systems you build directly enhance the customer experience. As a Software Engineer, you’ll be challenged by the complexity of building distributed systems at scale and will have the opportunity to collaborate across teams and countries.
   

  

**We Believe You Have**
* A relevant degree in Computer Science or a related field.
* 3-6 years of professional experience in software engineering.
* Solid experience with Java or Kotlin and building APIs.
* Familiarity with databases (e.g., PostgreSQL) and event-driven architectures.
* Some experience or interest in AWS, Kubernetes, and Elasticsearch.
* A passion for problem-solving and building scalable solutions.
* Strong communication skills in English (written and spoken).


**It’s a Bonus If You Have**
* Experience with cloud technologies (AWS, Kubernetes) and distributed systems.
* Knowledge of Kafka or similar messaging systems.
* Experience working with large-scale, high-availability systems.


 We are looking for candidates who are proactive, innovative, and motivated to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
   

  

 Other information
   

  

 Start date: As soon as possible
   

  

 Scope: Full-time position (100%)
   

  

 Location: Stockholm.
   

  

 Selection process: We apply continuous selection, which means the position may be filled before the application deadline.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or the recruitment process, feel free to contact the responsible recruiter Ronja Bergman on ronja.bergman@techtalents.se
   

  

 Does this sound like the position for you? We look forward to hearing from you – warmly welcome with your application!
   

  

 In this recruitment, Zalando is collaborating with Tech Talents, and we direct applications to Tech Talents.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Din roll
   

  

 Som Data Engineer hos oss kommer du att arbeta som konsult och få möjlighet att samarbeta med olika kunder i varierande branscher. Du kommer att arbeta med att samla in, hantera och analysera stora mängder data för att stödja affärsbeslut och skapa innovativa lösningar. I rollen ingår att designa och implementera dataflöden som är skalbara och effektiva, samt bidra med insikter och förbättringar för att optimera våra processer.
   

  

 Du kommer att få erfarenhet av olika miljöer och utmaningar, vilket ger dig en unik möjlighet att bredda din kompetens och förståelse för hur data kan användas för att driva verksamheter framåt. I nära samarbete med andra team kommer du att vara med och utveckla lösningar som möjliggör smart och datadriven verksamhet.
   

  

 Det här är en roll där du får möjlighet att arbeta med hela datalivscykeln och bidra till att skapa insikter som driver beslut och innovation.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Datainsamling samt att bygga och underhålla data pipelines och flöden, ELT/ETL, och Airflow.
* Större datalagringslösningar såsom data warehouses, data lakes och delta lakes.
* Datahantering inklusive datamodellering och rensning.
* Datavisualisering och analys med verktyg som Power BI, QlikSense och Grafana.
* Utveckling av REST API:er.
* Det är krav på svenska i tal och skrift samt svenskt medborgarskap.


 Du har dessutom kunskap och intresse av:
   

  

* Kringliggande discipliner som data science, maskininlärning, analys och statistik.
* Azure och Databricks.
* Python och gärna PySpark.


 Varför Knowit?
   

  

 På Knowit Connectivity får du möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö där vi kombinerar teknik och kreativitet för att skapa värde för våra kunder. Du blir en del av ett kompetent team där samarbete och kunskapsdelning är i fokus. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas, lära dig nya teknologier och arbeta i spännande projekt.
   

  

 Låter detta som en roll för dig?
   

  

 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bli en del av vårt team.

title: Data & Analytics Consultant
description:
**Job Description:**
 We are Merkle Sweden - part of Merkle Northern Europe. Merkle is a leader in data-driven customer experience management (CXM), and we help the world's best brands deliver unique, personalized customer experiences across channels and devices. We provide expertise in digital analytics, customer experience strategy and consulting, user experience design, CRM, data management, commerce, content management systems (CMS), ad tech and martech. We are part of Merkle Worldwide and dentsu – a global agency network covering 145 markets.
   

  

 Our Swedish Data & Analytics team is now looking for a Data & Analytics Consultant to join our journey and help us grow.
   

  

 Merkle is looking for a driven specialist with a huge interest in data and analytics. You’ll be based in either Gothenburg or Stockholm. You may also work from a distance.
   

  

* Implement metrics for clients and provide regular analysis.
* Give recommendations for measurement solutions for digital services based on clients’ business and activity goals.
* Maintain and develop a strong know-how of Google Marketing Platform in general and Google Analytics 360 in particular. Other measurement tools may be used.
* Provide insights and recommendations that improve clients’ activities and business.
* Develop data-visualization solutions (in dashboards) that make it possible for clients to follow sales and other important performance indicators in real time.


**Qualifications**
* Experience working with large amounts of data and an understanding of SQL and databases.
* In-depth knowledge of working with Google Analytics data, being an advanced user.
* An eye for details, logical thinking, and good problem-solving skills.
* Good communication skills in Swedish and English, both in speaking and writing.
* Used to presenting to both large and small groups of varying degrees of knowledge, internally within the Group and also with clients.
* Good self-management skills and a positive attitude toward change.
* Ability to manage different work tasks and projects and prioritize accordingly as you will be working with several clients and projects at the same time.
* Ability to work with data analysis and provide accurate recommendations based on data.


 Knowledge of data-visualization tools, formal statistics training, and experience with Google Cloud (especially BigQuery) are desirable.
   

  

 Additional information
   

  

 Our extensive experience and deep proficiency in Google Analytics 360 and Google Optimize mean that our clients rely on us for their most complex, challenging assignments. Our finances are stable (AAA), and we have a collective agreement and attractive benefits. Several years in a row, we have won the DI Gasell Award, won the Mästargasellen Award, and been named a “Superföretag” (Super Company) by Veckans Affärer and Bisnode.
   

  

 Some of the Perks We Offer:
   

  

* Friendly, knowledgeable colleagues who like to share their knowledge.
* Possibility to work with multinational companies in a number of different industries, meaning you get a wide range of experience and the chance to work with different data sets.
* Working for a certified reseller of several Google Marketing Platform products and working closely with Google in Sweden, England, Ireland, and the United States. We are the biggest player in the Nordics when it comes to Google Analytics 360.
* Continuous personal development in the form of lab days, groups exchanging experiences, and your own professional development budget.
* Working from an office by Skrapan on Södermalm, Stockholm, or by Nordstan in Gothenburg.
* The chance to grow both within your area of specialty and within Dentsu, the global network Merkle Outfox/Northern Europe is a part of.


 Is your heart racing a little now? If you can see yourself in all this – both the job and being part of Merkle – we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 Please send us your CV.
   

  

 There is no application deadline, finding the right candidate is more important to us than a speedy process. We remove the job-ad when filling the position.
   

  

**Location:**
 Stockholm
   

  

**Brand:**
 Merkle
   

  

**Time Type:**
 Full time
   

  

**Contract Type:**
 Permanent

title: Network Architect
description:
**Job Description**
 The world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your role**
 You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and optimizing the organization’s network infrastructure, ensuring it is robust, scalable, and aligned with business goals.
   

  

*In this role, you will play a key part in:*
* Leading the design and implementation of Network infrastructures, including LAN, WAN, VPNs, cloud networks, and SD-WAN.
* Collaborating with IT and business stakeholders to understand requirements and develop a long-term strategic roadmap for Network architecture.
* Ensuring network solutions are Scalable, high-performing, secure, and aligned with business objectives.
* Designing and implementing Network security solutions to safeguard the network infrastructure while ensuring compliance with Security policies and Regulatory requirements.
* Continuously monitoring and evaluating Network performance, Identifying, and Implementing optimization techniques to enhance speed, reliability, and scalability.
* Researching, evaluating, and recommending New Networking technologies, hardware, and software solutions.
* Leading the troubleshooting of complex Network issues and providing guidance to network engineers on resolving day-to-day network problems.
* Identifying opportunities to implement Network automation tools to streamline operations and improve efficiency.


**Your profile**
* Proven experience in designing and implementing enterprise-level network infrastructures.
* Strong expertise in Networking technologies, including LAN, WAN, VPNs, SD-WAN, cloud networking, and network security.
* Hands-on experience with Network hardware such as Routers, Switches, Firewalls, and load balancers.
* Familiarity with Cloud platforms and hybrid network architectures.
* Experience with network automation tools and scripting languages (e.g., Python, Ansible) is a plus.
* Relevant certifications such as CCNP, CCIE, AWS Certified Advanced Networking, or similar are highly desirable.


*Note: You will be required to pass through SC Security Clearance if you are successful in this recruitment process, which is a condition of undertaking the role.*
**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Career growth opportunities with access to training and certifications in the latest Networking technologies.


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Seniorkonsult Microsoft 365 – Modern Workplace & Cloud Transformation
description:
**Beskrivning av tjänsten** 




 CGI expanderar och söker fler erfarna och drivna Microsoft 365-specialister till vår växande konsultverksamhet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i långsiktiga och stabila leveranser med tydliga åtaganden – tillsammans med några av Sveriges största och mest välkända organisationer inom både offentlig och privat sektor.
 



 Vi genomför just nu en strategisk satsning på Microsoft Cloud, där vi transformerar vår hybrid cloud-leverans för att möta det ökade behovet av moderna, säkra och skalbara MS 365-lösningar. Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala arbetsplats? Då vill vi gärna ha din ansökan redan idag!
 



  





 Du kommer att utgå från Stockholm och tillhöra en konsultgruppering med ett 20-tal kompetenta CGI Partners. Utöver det kommer du att bidra med din expertis i ett virtuellt kompetensteam inom Microsoft Cloud-området, där vi tillsammans driver innovation, kunskapsdelning och teknisk utveckling.
 



  





**Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som Senior Microsoft 365-konsult kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i våra kunders digitala transformation.
 



  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:** 




  




* Modern Workplace-strategi, rådgivning och teknisk implementation.
* Roller som Subject Matter Expert, teknisk projektledare eller seniorkonsult i större projekt.
* Design och implementation av lösningar inom Microsoft Teams, Exchange Online, SharePoint, OneDrive, Intune, Defender och Purview.
* Zero Trust-arkitektur, identitetshantering och informationsskydd.
* Automatisering och effektivisering med PowerShell, Power Platform och Microsoft Graph API.
* Arbeta i agila team med etablerade metoder och modeller (t.ex. ITIL, SAFe, DevSecOps).



  





**Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll** 




  





 Flerårig erfarenhet från branschen i och gärna från en konsultroll
 



 Enhet och-applikationshantering (Intune)
 



 Microsoft Säkerhetskoncept (Microsoft 365 Defender
 



 Microsoft Samarbetsplattform (Teams, Exchange Online, m.fl.)
 



 Informationsskydd och efterlevnad (Microsoft Purview).
 



 Powershell / Python
 



 Visio eller likvärdigt designverktyg
 



  





**Vi erbjuder dig** 




  




* En utvecklande arbetsmiljö där du bidrar till att förbättra IT-upplevelsen hos varierande och välkända organisationer
* En kultur där du kan vara med och påverka din egen resa och karriär
* Ett väletablerat och lönsamt företag, där du redan från första arbetsdagen har möjlighet att bli delägare i vårt partnerprogram
* En teambaserad organisation där du arbetar tillsammans med andra CGI-kollegor



  





 På CGI vet vi vilken rikedom mångfald ger. Vi strävar efter att skapa en arbetskultur där alla känner sig välkomna och vi samarbetar med våra kunder för att skapa ett inkluderande samhälle. Som en jämställd arbetsgivare vill vi ge alla våra medlemmar samma möjlighet att lyckas och utvecklas.Är du redo att bli en del av vår framgångsresa? Börja hos oss på CGI – där dina idéer och handlingar gör skillnad.
 



  





 Om du har frågor om jobbet är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande ledare Fredrik Berglund, fredrik.berglund@cgi.com.

title: Security Specialist
description:
**Join our Team**
**About the Opportunity:**
 Join our Security & Architecture team as an Information and Communication Technology (ICT) Security Analyst. In this role, you will ensure proper protection of information assets, managed and accessed through the Ericsson R&D IT and Test Environment. As an ICT security analyst in the Security & Architecture unit in BNEW SAN Lab Operations, your role is to drive the implementation of security compliance through performing and coordination of the activities for the information security risk assessments, security incident management, vulnerability management and IT security assessments.
   

  

 Your job will include a deep understanding of Ericsson ISMS and Information Security Requirements. This will help you shepherd the organization forward in protecting the information assets own and managed in SAN SAL Lab Operations, as we continue our transformation into a DevSecOps service delivery organization.
   

  

 In this role, you will support all units in BNEW SAN SAL Lab Operations in information security, IT security and business continuity areas.
   

  

**This role is based in Sweden and geographical re-location is not possible for this position.**
**What you will do:**
* Serve as an IT Security Expert and trusted security advisor in BNEW SAN SAL Lab Operations
* Own and drive ISRA process in BNEW SAN SAL Lab Operations throughout the annual ISRA cycle
* Support in reviewing existing and new IT services and solutions to build security into the architecture, identify design gaps and recommend security enhancements in solutions and services
* Contribute to internal and external IT security assessments/audits
* Support IT security incidents in accordance with agreed and established process
* Establish and leverage interfaces to relevant functions and experts
* Manage Business Continuity/Service Continuity Management documentation & provide support within BNEW SAN SAL Lab Operations


**Skills you bring:**
* MSC or equivalent experience
* Minimum 5 years of experience in information security and business continuity management, along with technical hands-on experience in one or more of security domain areas of access control, communications security, operations security, securing cloud environments and/or operating systems/virtualized environments, network architecture and design etc.
* Minimum 5 years of experience in leading and driving roles
* In-depth and working knowledge of ISO 27002 ISO 27002 controls and their application in securing Ericsson's information technology environments
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills with business acumen
* Good collaboration skills and strong commitment as a team player
* Ability to engage with a wide range of stakeholders to evaluate and implement security measures while remaining up to date with emerging security threats and design security architecture to mitigate them
* Analytical skills with an understanding of security protocols, cryptography, authentication, authorization and security vulnerabilities etc
* Strong knowledge in Ericsson Security Policies, Directives and Instructions & knowledge of Ericsson business environment
* In depth Disaster Recovery competence


 As behavioural Competences, expected to show a strong ability in:
   

  

* Taking the ownership of an area and drive it forward
* Formulating strategies & concepts while deciding and initiating action
* Leading, supervising, Persuading & influencing
* Adapting & responding to change
* Adhering to Ericsson principles & values
* Coping with pressures & setbacks
* Delivering results and meeting stakeholder expectation


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 767121

title: Solutions Architect- Knowledge Factory
description:
Vi söker en Microsoft Infrastructure
 *Solutions Architect* 
*till* 
 Advanias specialistenhet Knowledge Factory!
   

  

*Brinner du för innovativa lösningar? Är du en naturlig ledare som får med dig dina kollegor och kunder? Vänder sig kunder till dig när de behöver stöd och hjälp? Vi behöver din hjälp för att kunna leverera de bästa tekniska och strategiska lösningarna.*
 Solutions Architect på Advania-KF 🚀
   

  

 Rollen är baserad i Sverige och du rapporterar direkt till en av våra Captains. Vårt team präglas av ödmjukhet, samverkan och vi är blixtsnabba till förändring.
   

  

 Specialistenheten Knowledge Factory på Advania har några av de vassaste experterna på marknaden inom olika områden. Vi jobbar i små team och alltid nära kunden.
   

  

 Som Solution Architect, SA, är du del av området Solutions som spänner över våra teknikområden såsom Identity, Devices, Modern Work, Datacenter, Integration Platform med flera. Du arbetar med och utvecklar de lösningar som levereras av våra Solution Architects gällande kvalitet, innovation och effektivitet.
   

  

 I din roll har du möjlighet att bygga relationer och leverera tekniska och strategiska lösningar som skapar värde för kundens verksamhet. Du har god relation med våra kunder och du träffar dem ofta.
   

  

 Du arbetar aktivt med omvärldsbevakning och är väl insatt i ny teknik inom ditt specialistområde. Din uppgift handlar om att ha god förståelse för Advanias erbjudande och kunna matcha våra kunders behov med rätt kompetens från Advania.
   

  

**Som Solutions Architect förväntar vi oss att du:**
* agerar Trusted Advisor och bygger långsiktiga relationer med våra kunder
* coachar och driver området Solutions för våra kunder
* ansvarar för och medverkar i hela leveransen eller specifika delar, ofta i större projekt, samt säkerställer god kvalitet
* interagerar direkt med beslutsfattare på ledningsnivå och vägleder dem med de bästa tekniska lösningarna och strategierna
* driver workshops och utbildningar


 Vad vi söker hos dig ✨
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har tung erfarenhet i branschen och har arbetat som lösningsarkitekt tidigare. Du har erfarenhet som konsult och är van att sätta dig in i nya miljöer och utmaningar. Du har en bred kompetens som spänner över flera teknikområden och har djup teknisk förståelse inom ett eller flera områden.
   

  

 Du är:
   

  

  

* bekväm med att driva dialog, förstå behov och utmaningar och arbeta nära kunderna på deras resa mot att modernisera sina plattformar.
* en kreativ och tydlig person som kan påvisa hur tekniska lösningar möter behov och levererar affärsnytta för ledning, IT och verksamhet.
* ansvarstagande, affärsdriven och motiveras av att nå resultat och skapa långsiktiga kundrelationer
* trygg i miljöer med kompetenta kollegor där du både utmanar och utmanas.


 Du delar gärna med dig av det du brinner för genom bloggar eller att hålla seminarier. Du är ett namn på marknaden med ett brett kontaktnät och förmågan att växa vår affär genom att identifiera nya möjligheter hos kund.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig ☀️**
 Här på Knowledge Factory får du utmanande arbetsuppgifter, ett sammansvetsat team och möjligheter att utvecklas inom några av våra kunders vassaste projekt. Vi ser gärna att du delar din kunskap genom seminarier och blogginlägg – du blir en del av vår attraktionskraft mot marknaden.
   

  

 Det är viktigare för oss att du är rätt person, nyfiken och villig att lära, än att du uppfyller alla kvalifikationer från start.  Vi stöttar dig och vill utvecklas tillsammans med dig och våra kunder!
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 👋
   

  

 Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.
   

  

 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.
   

  

 Det är du som arbetar nära kunden som vet vad dem behöver och vad som blir den bästa lösningen för just deras unika behov, både i dag och i morgon. Därför tycker vi att det är du som ska fatta besluten. Det är genom att erbjuda säkra, hållbara och kundanpassade lösningar som vi skapar värde för kunderna och samhället i stort.
   

  

 Vi bryr oss om hur våra medarbetare mår – på riktigt. Därför samarbetar Advania med Ljung & Sjöberg för att skapa en trygg, proaktiv arbetsmiljö med stöd kring alkohol-, drog- och beroenderelaterade frågor. Tillsammans bygger vi en hållbar arbetsplats där det är okej att be om hjälp, och där förebyggande arbete gör skillnad – för individen, teamet och företaget.
   

  

 I en miljö präglad av stort kundfokus och frihet under ansvar blir det extra viktigt för oss att bygga starka team bestående av ödmjuka stjärnor. Att arbeta i en inkluderande miljö, med kollegor och kunder som vill utvecklas, ger oss möjligheten att trivas och ha riktigt roligt på jobbet. Vi tror på en platt organisation med agilt arbetssätt och flexibilitet. Detta är det enda sättet för en hållbar framtid.
   

  

 Advania Sverige, ”The tech company with people at heart”, har kontor över hela landet, från Luleå i norr till Malmö i syd. Dagligen hjälper våra 1 700 specialister våra kunder, både inom privat och offentlig sektor, i deras ambitioner och mål att digitalisera sina verksamheter. Genom långsiktiga relationer, ledande teknologier, moderna plattformslösningar och strategiska partnerskap formar vi framtidens IT-landskap. Vårt syfte sträcker sig bortom teknik: att ge människor kraften att skapa hållbara värden.
   

  

 Advaniagruppen levererar tjänster till kunder i Sverige, Norge, Storbritannien, Island, Finland och Danmark inom hållbar och säker digitalisering.

title: Lösningsarkitekt
description:
*Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja ett företag där du får möjlighet att forma din karriär på det sätt du önskar. Här kommer att få stöd och inspiration inom en samarbetsvillig gemenskap med kollegor både lokalt och runt om i världen, som ständigt omdefinierar vad som är möjligt. Du kommer vara en del av området Cloud and Custom Application (C&CA) på Capgemini. Här kommer du arbeta med de senaste teknologierna inom Cloud, Integration, AI och mjukvaruutveckling. Vi utvecklar skräddarsydda applikationer och hanterar komplexa integrationer för att maximera teknikens potential. Följ med oss och samarbeta med världens ledande organisationer för att realisera teknikens fulla värde genom innovativa lösningar*
**Om rollen**
 Som lösningsarkitekt har du en bred teknisk bakgrund samtidigt som du förstår verksamhetens behov och utmaningar och kan omsätta dessa till funktionella och icke-funktionella krav. Du kan hantera och mitigera risker, samla intressenter, har goda ledaregenskaper och är en duktig kommunikatör.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du in tidigt in i projekten med uppgiften att förstå verksamhetens mål och behov för att omsätta detta till den lösningsarkitektur som ger mest värde till verksamheten. Du arbetar i tät samverkan med både expertkollegor från Capgemini och kunden, tillsammans med utvecklingsteam, produktägare och kundens övriga intressenter.
   

  

 Vår starka position på marknaden med kunder som är Sveriges största och mest välkända både inom den publika och privata sektorn har gett oss möjligheten till omfattande och spännande åtaganden inom digital transformation. Det utmanar oss att ständigt utvecklas.
   

  

 Vi arbetar professionellt och metodiskt i en lärande miljö och både din teamchef och ditt kompetensteam stöttar dig och din utveckling som konsult. Vi träffas ofta för att utbyta erfarenheter, lära oss nya saker i en bransch som ständigt förändras – och inte minst för att ha kul tillsammans!
   

  

**Din profil**
* Flera års erfarenhet som lösningsarkitekt
* Bakgrund inom systemutveckling, och vana av att leda andra
* Erfarenhet av arbete med etablerade metodiker och ramverk för arkitektur och agil systemutveckling.
* Högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande
* Goda kunskaper i såväl svenska som engelska


**… och erfarenhet eller intresse av:**
* Konsultrollen samt av arbete med beslutsfattare
* Att verka utifrån kundens perspektiv och förmåga att analysera och utforma arkitektur och systemlösningar baserat på verksamhetens krav, processer och informationsbehov
* Molnbaserade lösningar, AI, säkerhet, processautomatisering eller integration
* Arbete som lösningsarkitekt i komplexa miljöer
* Certifierad IT-arkitekt


**Vad vi tror kommer att få dig att trivas**
* En positiv arbetsmiljö med starkt fokus på innovation och kompetens. Du kommer att arbeta med många av de senaste tekniktrenderna och vara omgiven av duktiga kollegor.
* På Capgemini blir du en del av en global organisation med starkt kundfokus, samarbetskultur och möjlighet till kontinuerligt lärande och utveckling.
* Vårt Digital Architecture-team i Stockholm består av ca 20 kollegor som arbetar som Enterprise-, Verksamhets- och lösningsarkitekter hos våra kunder.
* Capgemini har varit en dominerande aktör inom arkitekturområdet sedan 90-talet, med vårt eget ramverk Integrated Architecture Framework (IAF) och vi bidrar även aktivt till vidareutvecklingen av TOGAF.
* Vi har ett aktivt, globalt arkitektforum med lokala undergrupper där du kan dra nytta av globala och lokala experter inom arkitektur och även bidra med din egen erfarenhet.
* Våra värderingar: Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team spirit, Modesty and Fun


**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Senior Sales Engineer
description:
**Who are we?**
 Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company®, operating over 260 data centers across the globe. Digital leaders harness Equinix's trusted platform to bring together and interconnect foundational infrastructure at software speed. Equinix enables organizations to access all the right places, partners and possibilities to scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences and multiply their value, while supporting their sustainability goals.
   

  

 A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 Field sales engineering position selling Equinix solutions to new accounts and/or expanding existing accounts
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Technical Consulting and Sales Support
   

  

* Identifies customer’s business needs, challenges, and technical requirements and maps to Equinix solutions
* Understands and explains customer applications and business challenges
* Utilizes understanding of Equinix portfolio of products to deliver pitch on Equinix solutions
* Analyses situations and data on problems of moderate scope
* Provides full support for medium to large customers, including global deployments


 Solution Design and Deliverables
   

  

* Provides technical solution design expertise to all assigned Sales account executives
* Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to figure out appropriate solution
* Assists in RFI/P/Q preparation as requested by Sales Representatives
* Independently delivers all work for the customer


 Customer Service
   

  

* Communicates with customers (internal and external) in a professional, friendly and effective manner, both verbally and in writing
* Assists in pre-sales efforts for all company products
* Provides technical support in sales presentations, customer meetings, and trade shows


 Business and Market Expertise
   

  

* Demonstrates a solid understanding of Equinix datacenter, Network, and Cloud products and services
* Possesses industry knowledge and familiarity with the competitive landscape


 Collaboration / Communication
   

  

* Develops new business opportunities and grows existing customer relationships
* Motivates internal teams (CSM, OM, IM, Ops, etc.) to ensure smooth project transition from pre-sales to post-sales
* Influences the cultivation of a positive culture on the team
* Demonstrates good presentation skills


 Team Leadership
   

  

* Supports initiatives and team projects to better the organization


**Qualifications**
 Essential
   

  

* Degree in Engineering / IT or equivalent experience
* Extensive Customer facing experience within internet, cloud or telecommunications services industry
* In-depth knowledge of Networks and/or Cloud Computing
* Ability to work independently with minimal management guidance
* Problem resolution
* Ability to understand and explain related technical issues, thorough knowledge of products, potential applications and associated technologies
* Outstanding interpersonal skills – ability to professionally communicate and interact with all levels of internal and external customers
* Creation of high quality business proposals in line with agreed customer needs and expectations
* Ability to project manage, multitask and follow through
* Ability to work and adapt in rapidly changing environment
* Excellent English written and oral communications skills
* Negotiation skills


 Desired
   

  

* Understanding of Business Procedures i.e Finance, Marketing, Forecasting, Business Plans and Contracts
* Relationship building skills
* Provision of accurate forecasts and reports
* Process orientation, analytical and deductive reasoning skills
* Experience with customer support systems
* Strong knowledge and experience with telecom circuit ordering and provisioning
* In depth understanding of datacentre architecture
* UPS, Generator, Cooling, Fire detection and suppression
* In-depth knowledge of UK cabling standards and implementation


 Equinix is committed to ensuring that our employment process is open to all individuals, including those with a disability. If you are a qualified candidate and need assistance or an accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
   

  

 Equinix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and, in the U.S., an Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to unlawful consideration of race, color, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, sex, pregnancy / childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic partnership status, age, veteran or military status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, political / organizational affiliation, status as a victim or family member of a victim of crime or abuse, or any other status protected by applicable law.

title: Systemansvarig- central roll i Bankomats värdeverksamhet
description:
Drivs du av förbättringsarbete och vill kontinuerligt utveckla både system och arbetssätt? Har du förmågan att se både detaljer och helhet, och vill arbeta i en verksamhetsnära central roll? Då kan det vara dig vi söker.
 



  





 Bankomat söker nu en engagerad och lösningsorienterad systemansvarig till vår värdeverksamhet. I denna roll ansvarar du för drift, utveckling och förbättring av affärskritiska system kopplade till logistik och transporter. Du kommer att fungera som en viktig länk mellan teknik, användare och verksamhet – med ett stort ansvar och möjlighet att göra verklig skillnad.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som systemansvarig kommer du att ha ett övergripande ansvar för system kopplade till värdeverksamheten. Du arbetar nära både interna intressenter och externa leverantörer för att säkerställa att systemen är stabila, användarvänliga och anpassade efter verksamhetens behov. Vi ser framför oss en utåtriktad, energirik och nyfiken person som trivs med att verka ute i den geografiskt sprida verksamheten för att fånga upp förbättringsförslag och vara en ambassadör för de system du ansvarar för.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Övervakning av systemens prestanda och hantering av driftstörningar.
* Planering och samordning av förändringar, uppgraderingar och utvecklingsinitiativ, inklusive leda testarbete inför uppgraderingar
* Hantera tekniska problem, ge stöd till användare och samarbeta med andra tekniska team för att lösa eventuella problem.
* Användarstöd samt administration av användarbehörigheter.
* Dokumentation av system, processer och förändringar.
* Analys av loggar och rapporter för att identifiera förbättringsmöjligheter.
* Utbildning och stöd för användare.
* Deltagande i projekt samt kontinuerlig återkoppling till systemägare.



  





**Kvalifikationer** 



* God förståelse för IT-system, databaser, nätverk och operativsystem
* Teknisk förståelse för systemförvaltning, integrationer och IT-säkerhet.
* Trivs med att arbeta med förbättringsarbete, är nyfiken och har ett lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt.
* Är strukturerad, självgående och har förmåga att driva arbetet framåt i samverkan med andra.
* Kommunicerar tydligt med såväl tekniska som icke-tekniska målgrupper.
* Har erfarenhet av dokumentation, användarstöd och förändringsledning.



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Erfarenhet av liknande roll.
* Erfarenhet av system inom logistik, transport eller värdehantering.



  





**Vi erbjuder** 



* En viktig och självständig roll i en verksamhet där säkerhet, kvalitet och effektivitet är centrala.
* En engagerad arbetsmiljö med möjlighet till kompetensutveckling.
* Möjlighet att påverka systemlösningar och arbetssätt.
* En viktig roll och ett stort operativs ansvar



  





**Ansökan och mer information** 




 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Bankomat AB med Compass. Du söker tjänsten via länken nedan och vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande, så ansök gärna så snart som möjligt. För mer information om bolaget och tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Compass ansvariga konsult Susanne Bryhn 070-531 34 25.
 



  





 Tjänsten kommer att placeras i säkerhetsklass. Det innebär att i denna roll behöver du vara svensk medborgare för att vara aktuell.
 



  





 För slutkandidaten kommer det att genomföras en grundlig bakgrundskontroll och eventuellt även en säkerhetsprövning.
 



  





*Bankomat är Sveriges ledande aktör inom kontanthantering. Vi erbjuder människor möjlighet att ta ut och sätta in kontanter via våra välkända blå automater, som finns på nästan 600 orter i Sverige. För oss är det viktigt att de som vill använda kontanter har den möjligheten. Vi har en heltäckande infrastruktur av uttags- och insättningsautomater över hela landet. I 250 av våra automater erbjuder vi även de vanligaste valutorna euro, brittiska pund och amerikanska dollar.* 




  





*Bankomat har påbörjat ett arbete för att kunna starta egen värdehantering. Syftet är att själva kunna transportera kontanter mellan företagets depåer och automater.* 




  





*Kännetecknande för vår organisation är att vi arbetar med komplexa tjänsteleveranser och arbetar kontinuerligt med förändringsarbete och innovation. I dagsläget är vi ca 100 medarbetare som arbetar tillsammans i en platt organisation.* 




**Välkommen att söka!**

title: Business Developer
company_industry: Information Technology & Services and Software Development
description:
*Vill du vara med och driva ett techbolag framåt – inte bara analysera, utan leda och förändra på riktigt? På Geposit söker vi nu en affärsutvecklare som tar kommersiella initiativ från idé till verklighet. Det här är en roll för dig som gillar att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt – och som vill göra skillnad i ett växande bolag. Låter det spännande? Läs vidare!* 




  





 Geposit är ett Stockholmsbaserat SaaS-företag som – tillsammans med vårt systerbolag Tetrasoft – erbjuder smarta digitala tjänster för företag med verksamhet ute på fältet. Tillsammans hjälper vi företag inom transport- och servicesektorn att fatta bättre beslut, planera sina verksamheter på ett smartare sätt och därigenom arbeta mer effektivt.
 



  





 Geposit fokuserar på det geografiska perspektivet i affärsdrivande processer med digitala lösningar som adressvalidering via API, kartbaserad zonindelning och geotargeting. Tetrasoft kompletterar med kraftfull mjukvara för ruttplanering och optimering där stora mängder transportuppdrag och resurser koordineras för att maximera effektivitet. Vi vänder oss särskilt till företag inom transport- och servicesektorn där effektiv operativ planering är avgörande för att lyckas.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Business Developer hos oss kommer du ha en central roll i att forma och driva vår kommersiella utveckling. Du arbetar nära VD och leder initiativ som stärker vår försäljning, vårt erbjudande och vår samverkan med våra systerbolag. Rollen är bred och kombinerar strategiskt tänkande med operativt genomförande.
 



  





 Du kommer bland annat att:
 


* **Driva kommersiella satsningar** 
 – tillsammans med VD leda arbetet med att identifiera tillväxtmöjligheter och driva prioriterade initiativ.
* **Leda och utveckla försäljningen** 
 – stötta och coacha våra säljare, förbättra säljprocesser och bidra till ett mer strukturerat och effektivt säljarbete.
* **Förstå våra kunder på djupet** 
 – sätta dig in i kundernas behov, problem, arbetssätt och IT-ekosystem för att säkerställa att vi erbjuder lösningar som är relevanta på riktigt.
* **Forma och förbättra vårt erbjudande** 
 – arbeta med paketering, kommunikation och produktutveckling med kunden i centrum.
* **Samordna strategiska samarbeten** 
 – driva gemensamma projekt och erbjudanden tillsammans med våra systerbolag inom Progrits.



  





**Om dig** 




  





 Vi söker dig som är analytisk, driven och har en stark förmåga att omsätta insikter till actions för oss som bolag. Du trivs med att arbeta i en varierad roll där du får kombinera strategiskt tänkande med operativt arbete.
 



  





 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har:
 


* Relevant högskoleutbildning (exempelvis inom ekonomi, teknik eller management)
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att leda eller driva initiativ inom affärsutveckling
* Intresse för försäljning, paketering och kunddialog
* Förståelse för digitala tjänster, teknik och SaaS-modeller
* Meriterande: erfarenhet från management consulting, techbolag, transportsektorn eller att ha arbetat nära säljteam



  





 Som person är du strukturerad, lösningsorienterad och har en god social förmåga. Du har en naturlig drivkraft och ger inte upp när du ställs inför utmaningar – du har grit!
 



  





 Då våra kunder till stor del finns i Sverige behöver du kunna kommunicera obehindrat på svenska i både tal och skrift.
 



  





**Låter det intressant – kontakta oss** 




  





 Låter det här som en roll och en arbetsmiljö som du skulle trivas i – då vill vi gärna höra mer från dig! Sök jobbet, connecta med oss eller dela detta med någon du tror skulle passa in.
 



  





 Har du frågor om tjänsten, teamet eller företaget hör du av dig till Elin Andersson, People & Talent Specialist, på Progrits.
 



  





***En del av Progrits***




  





*Du blir del av Progrits - en mjukvarukoncern med ledande marknadspositioner och produkter, ett stort tillväxtfokus och en tydlig strategi. Sedan 2023 är Progrits en del av Axcel, ett nordiskt riskkapitalbolag med stort intresse för tech-sektorn.* 




  





*Att vara en del av Progrits innebär ökade möjligheter för utveckling både för oss som företag och för dig som anställd, och samtidigt större trygghet.* 




  





*Är du som vi, tror vi att du vill känna meningsfullhet på jobbet – och vara med om att göra Geposit till ett ännu bättre och roligare ställe att jobba på. För roligt är viktigt – jobbet är en för stor del av livet för att inte ha kul!*

title: OneStream Lead Architect
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Professional Training and Coaching, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Who is the company and context?** 




 Our client is an international CFO advisory firm looking to strengthen their EPM practise in Stockholm. They are seeking an
 **OneStream Lead Architect** 
 to play a key role in bridging the gap between business and IT departments at large corporations across various industries. This is a
 **permanent position** 
 within an established consultancy where you will work on complex financial systems and process change projects.
 



  





**What will I be doing?** 



* Design and implement OneStream solutions for FP&A and Group Consolidation projects, bridging business and IT functions at major corporations
* Architect complete models in OneStream and develop reporting systems from conception to delivery
* Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand customer pain points, identify improvement opportunities, and create effective technical solutions



  





**What kind of skills and background will I need to have?** 



* Track record of delivering OneStream transformation projects, guiding stakeholders on what is feasible to achieve
* Strong technical competency in OneStream, including proficiently in C# and VB.net
* Knowledge of data integration and databases e.g. SQL and related database technologies
* Strong understanding of finance processes (e.g., FP&A, accounting, consolidation)
* Fluent in English; Swedish language skills are a plus
* Proficiency in other EPM technologies such as Oracle, SAP, Anaplan, Tagetik, Board, IBM Planning Analytics/TM1, Workiva, Workday Adaptive Planning, Lucanet, Prophix, or Pigment is also desirable



  





**Why join this company?** 




 A great opportunity for someone who to join a company driving impactful digital finance transformations. You will have access to coaching, mentorship, and training opportunities in cutting edge technology solutions.
 



  





**How to apply?** 




 If this opportunity aligns with your experience and ambitions, or if you would like more information, please contact
 **Herman Hille-Dahl** 
 at
 **herman.hille-dahl@systemsaccountants.com** 




  





**Who are we?** 




 SystemsAccountants is a leading global financial systems, analytics, and transformation recruitment company. We provide permanent and contract solutions, helping organisations implement, support, develop, manage, and optimise EPM, ERP, and analytics systems. Our consultants operate internationally, ensuring both clients and candidates benefit from a global network and tailored expertise.

title: 3GPP Security Architect
description:
The world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your role**
 You will be responsible for designing and implementing cybersecurity frameworks and solutions to protect 5G core networks in line with 3GPP security standards.
   

  

*In this role, you will play a key role in:*
* Leading the design and implementation of end-to-end cybersecurity architectures for the 5G core network, ensuring alignment with 3GPP security standards
* Applying in-depth knowledge of 3GPP security protocols for 5G networks, including security measures for user equipment (UE), access networks, and core networks
* Conducting comprehensive threat modelling and risk assessments for 5G core network services, identifying potential vulnerabilities and developing mitigation strategies.
* Developing and executing an end-to-end security strategy for the 5G core network, incorporating encryption, authentication, authorization, and data integrity mechanisms.
* Designing and implementing security controls for network slicing within the 5G core, ensuring isolated and secure environments for different service types and customers.
* Leading efforts to detect and respond to cyber incidents within the 5G core network, implementing advanced monitoring, logging, and alerting systems.
* Ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, industry standards (e.g., ISO 27001), and 3GPP security specifications.
* Collaborating with network engineering, operations, and product teams to integrate security measures into the design, implementation, and deployment of the 5G core network.
* Documenting security architecture designs, risk assessments, and incident response protocols, reporting to senior management on the status of 5G core network security.


**Your profile**
* Strong expertise in 5G core network architecture and 3GPP security standards.
* Experience in designing and implementing Cybersecurity solutions for telecom networks.
* Proficiency in 3GPP security protocols such as authentication, encryption, and key exchange.
* Hands-on experience in Threat modelling, Risk assessment, and Incident response.
* Deep understanding of Network slicing security, Encryption mechanisms, and Regulatory compliance (ISO 27001, GDPR, NIST, etc.).


*Note: You will be required to pass through SC Security Clearance if you are successful in this recruitment process, which is a condition of undertaking the role.*
**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies in the 5G and cybersecurity domain, including professional certifications in cybersecurity and Telecom security.


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Senior Account Executive II
description:
**Join Collibra’s Sales team as a Senior Account Executive, Nordics**
 Make an impact at Collibra by fuelling Collibra's growth in your assigned territory of the Nordics and be the guiding force behind bringing Collibra's value and vision to customers and prospects. As part of our Enterprise Sales team, you will manage some of Collibra’s largest customers and prospects.
